description: Right out of California. This is a sharp looking factory red, factory air conditioned Mustang. Dressed up with scooped hood, stripes, Magnum 500 wheels with white letter tires. The body and floors appear to be really clean original metal. Has original quarter panels, the bottom door seems are clean and dry. Has rechromed rear bumper, front bumper is a rubber enduro. Windshield looks new, weatherstrips appear to be in excellent shape. Looks like a well preserved original interior. Very clean door panels, seats are in real good shape, console, instrument area are not beat up. Carpets are good with pony floor mats. It does have a black convertible top and boot cover. Trunk is clean with a spare and comes with a couple boxes of miscellaneous spare parts. Motor compartment is cleaned and painted. Very well sorted, the previous owner kept up with the maintenance. A/C is cold. This is a sharp, great running convertible!

description: Just in is this Q Code 1972 Ford Real Deal Mach One powered by its great running 351 4bb V8 engine backed up by a smooth shifting Top Loader 4 speed transmission. It comes equipped with working factory Air Conditioning working factory tachometer and gauges. It also has power steering power front disk brakes dual sport mirrors dual exhaust rear window louvers front chin spoiler and is riding on a nice set of Magnum 500 rims. Its floors frame and trunk floors are real solid throughout. Its exterior red paint with black stripes has been buffed to a real nice shine. This real deal Mach one runs and drives as nice as it looks and is ready to jump in and enjoy! Right before its restoration in 2006 it has a prior salvage title as a project car. Its lines are straight and true and the undercarriage doesn't show any damage so I can't understand why that was done. Its interior exterior were all restored since then and looks great. Please watch our 8 minute video on our home website www.coyoteclassics.com there you will see and hear this Mustang while driving down the road. I will also give you a full walk around description of its condition while the car is idling so you can hear it run. description: For sale in our Atlanta Showroom is a real Blue oval beauty, 1972 Ford Mustang Mach I. This 3rd generation Mustang Mach I for sale is built for driving and ready for cruise! This '72 Mustang Mach I for sale is powered by a peppy 351 cubic inch Cleveland small block Ford V8. Turn the key and you'll hear the epic rumble that the small block Fords are known for. Backed by a 4-speed Toploader manual transmission, this pretty pony is a blast to shift through the gears. The power is thrown to the ground via a Ford 8" rear and Cragar aftermarket wheels wrapped in radial tires. The exterior is a beautiful shade of Red, complimented with all the standard Mustang Mach I emblems and trim pieces. The car makes a statement, with a Mach I hood, grille, and blackout style striping! As this 1972 Ford Mustang Mach I for sale passes, you can't help but notice the rear louvers. All bases covered from the factory, you have a sexy fastback that's begging for a cruise. The exterior of this Mustang drips of masculine, 70s muscle car gusto! The interior is vintage, with Black vinyl sport buckets up front, and a Black vinyl bench in the back. With plenty of room for your friends and family, this driver quality 72' Ford Mustang Mach 1 for sale is the car you want for fun weekend trips with the windows down and tunes up! Options on this sexy stallion, include: AM/FM radio, power brakes, power steering, seat belts, vinyl interior, and aluminum/alloy wheels wrapped in radial tires. Now's your chance to own a classic Mustang, a collector piece that's constantly getting looks and praise. Surrounding the 50 year mark, the value of these 3rd gen ponies are really starting to be seen. To view the car in greater detail, including 100+ HD photos and HD video, please visit www.gatewayclassiccars.com. For more information please call the Atlanta showroom at 678-894-4833 or e-mail us at Atlanta@GatewayClassicCars.com.

description: This 1971 Ford Mustang Mach 1 is a very nice survivor!  The powerful 351 Cleveland V8 runs and drives great!  As you can see from the pictures, this car isn't perfect, but it is a survivor.  This car has several options that were not standard for this car, but in fact, upgrades.  The 351 engine is an upgraded model.  It also has air conditioning, power steering, power brakes, power windows, and power locks.  Average to high retail on this car is $40,000 to $65,000... so this is a great investment opportunity.  Come down today and take a look at this beautiful piece of history.
title: 1971 Ford Mustang

description: For sale in our Orlando showroom is a 1972 Ford Mustang convertible. This is your chance to buy a classic car that has 2.5 years left on a transferrable NATIONWIDE UNLIMITED MILEAGE WARRANTY  on the new remanufactured 302 / 5L  Jasper Engine (warranty provided by  Jasper ) This car will get up and go! Drive this classic with confidence . Options for this 1972 Ford Mustang convertible include: Automatic Convertible Top, Seat Belts, Vinyl Interior, Radial Tires, and Aluminum/Alloy Wheels. Powering this 72' Mustang drop top is 302 8 cylinder engine. It has a holly 4 barrel carburetor and electronic ignition ignitor coil . JBA 9mm ign wires , dual exhaust with Bova mufflers , new Monroe air shocks, new master cylinder, new battery , new top with glass window , new top motor, Kenwood Bluetooth, orginal Mustang Mag wheels .. The original C4 automatic transmission puts the power to the pavement. The black interior, black vinyl top, and black accents provide a perfect back drop to the White exterior paint. Of the 125,093 Mustangs produced in 1972, only 6,121 of them were convertibles. The 1972 Mustangs were very similar to the 71' Mustangs. The easiest identifier is the rear decklid Mustang lettering: the 71' Mustang had Mustang lettering that ran across the entire decklid while the 72' Mustang featured the Mustang script above the right taillights. This 72' Mustang convertible has been road tested since all the new parts and freshening up have been completed. It is ready for a nice Sunday afternoon cruise with the top down. To view this 1972 Ford Mustang convertible in greater detail, including HD pictures and an HD video, please visit www.GatewayClassicCars.com or our  Orlando  showroom. For more information, please call 407-771-2000 or email Orlando@GatewayClassicCars. com - See more at: http://www.gatewayclassiccars.com/orlando/1972/ford/mustang-S652.html

description: For sale in our Dallas showroom is an unexpected gem. A single family 1971 Ford Mustang. Yes that is right, this car has been in the same family since it was new. With that, practically every part on this car is original, engine, transmission, interior, top, everything. The mileage is believed to be 68,000 original miles. It did receive a repaint of the original Medium Yellow Gold color back in 1988 and has maintained a nice paint job ever since. The interior is the original Medium Ginger vinyl and is in great original condition. The car was ordered with the Select Shift, Cruise-O-Matic transmission, Sport Wheel Covers, Deluxe Interior, Sport Mirrors, and Side Mouldings. The Rest of the features include AC, AM Radio, Power Convertible Top, Power Brakes, Power Steering, Tilt Wheel, Seat belts, Raised White Letter Radial tires, and Vinyl Interior. All of this talk of original stuff including the AC we will tell you that the AC and the Heat need work to get working, but everything is there. title: 1971 Ford Mustang

description: Worldwide Vintage Autos is pleased to present this 1972 Ford Mustang. We scour the country for vintage cars and trucks and we rarely come across one like this! You must see and drive this rare Mustang!  HISTORY  From 1967 until 1973, the Mustang got bigger but not necessarily more powerful.The Mustang was facelifted, giving the Mustang a more massive look overall and allowing a big block engine to be offered for the first time. Front and rear end styling was more pronounced, and the "twin cove" instrument panel offered a thicker crash pad, and larger gauges. Hardtop, fastback and convertible body styles continued as before. Around this time, the Mustang was paired with a Mercury variant, called the Cougar, which used its own styling cues, such as a "cougar's head" logo and hidden quad headlamps. New safety regulations by the U.S. National Highway Traffic Safety Administration(NHTSA) for 1967 included an energy-absorbing steering column and wheel, 4-way emergency flashers, a dual-circuit hydraulic braking system, and softer interior knobs. The 1968 models received revised side scoops, steering wheel, and gasoline caps. Side marker lights were also added that year, and cars built after January 1, 1968 included shoulder belts for both front seats on coupes. The 1968 models also introduced a new 302 cu in (4.9 L) V8 engine, designed with Federal emissions regulations in mind. SOURCE:  WIKIPEDIA  SPECIFICS / BUILD INFORMATION  EXTERIOR   -Paint is Midnight blue.   -Mach 1 stripes.  -Falken Ziex S/TZ 255/50R17 rear and 225/50R17 front tires.  -Spoiler.  -New chrome rear bumper.  -Flip gas cap.    INTERIOR  -Hurst shifter.  -Super Pro Tachometer.  -Grant GT Steering Wheel.    MECHANICAL  -351 Cleveland boss V8 engine.  -New 4:11 ring and pinion.  -New disc brakes and shocks.  -Special order headers.  -Flow Master delta 40's.  -New Holley carburetor.  -This car is fast!!!!   DISCLOSURE  -There are a few chips / imperfections in the paint. (See detailed pictures)  For more details on any disclosure items please contact a sales agent today at 1-877-422-2640.    Own this vintage 1972 Ford Mustang at wholesale cost. The cost of parts and restoration of these vehicles are increasing daily. Buy one complete and ensure your investment for the future. Don't do the work yourself, get one finished for roughly half of the cost of building it yourself!   An excellent investment and something you can enjoy daily. Collectible vintage vehicles have historically appreciated at a rate greater than that stock market, gold and other arts and collectibles as documented by many articles and auction result tracking.     NEED MORE DETAILED INFORMATION? CALL US AND WE WILL HELP ANY WAY POSSIBLE!   1-877-422-2940  WORLDWIDE VINTAGE AUTOS [. C O M ]     FINANCING:  JJ BEST BANC. COLLECTOR CAR FINANCING  800-872-1965  Please mention you are working with Worldwide Vintage Autos in order to expedite the process.  DEPOSITS:  Deposits to hold vehicles is $500. Upon payment of the $500
title: 1972 Ford Mustang

description: Just when you thought all the affordable Mustangs were gone, this 1970 Ford Mustang coupe shows up with potent V8 power and a great high-performance look. With the fastbacks getting all the coverage, this coupe will stand out at any show and still offers the same great driving experience that all vintage Mustangs deliver.

Red always looks good on a Mustang, and with a repaint just a few years ago, this Brandywine coupe has a lot of style. The coupe neatly blends the aggressiveness of the fastback with a more conservative look, creating a car that looks fast but fits in anywhere. Paint and bodywork are nicely done, and this has never been a rusty car, so the sheetmetal is straight and it has a nice shine. Gaps are good, panel alignment is straight, and it's clear someone took their time putting it together. They didn't bother with stripes or other paint tricks, but it does have a chin spoiler, hood scoop, and rear wing to make it look aggressive. A lot of Mustang enthusiasts will argue that the front-end of the 1970 models was the best ever fitted to Ford's pony car, and there's simply no angle from which this car doesn't look good. It's got a clean, smooth look that's very appealing. Chrome trim is a combination of excellent original stuff and restored items, adding just enough flash to retain the 1960s look.

The interior is mostly original with a few upgrades that make it a lot of fun to drive. The high-back buckets wear what might very well be the original black vinyl seat covers, and aside from some wear on the driver's outer bolster, they're in good overall shape. The door panels are also probably original, showing faux wood inserts that make the Mustang feel upscale, and there's an aftermarket center console in the middle, complete with a pair of cup holders. The factory gauges in their deeply inset panel are all fully functional and are visible through the spokes of a custom Grant GT steering wheel with a matching black leather rim. The original radio is gone, replaced by an AM/FM/CD/iPod stereo head unit that fits in the original radio's slot without modifications, and new Mustang-logo floor mats have been installed to protect the carpets. The trunk has been freshened with gray mouse fur upholstery that is a bit more upscale than the original mats and gives it a polished look.

The engine is an F-code 302 cubic inch V8, which is how this car came from the factory.  Originally fitted with a 2-barrel carburetor and rated at 220 horsepower, it's significantly more muscular today thanks to a Summit Racing aluminum intake manifold, Edelbrock 4-barrel carburetor, and long-tube headers. A big chrome air cleaner announces the upgrades pretty clearly, and things like the valve covers and shock tower brace are chrome, so it has a great look. It's linked to a C4 3-speed automatic and a rock-solid 9-inch rear with 3.00 gears inside, so it's far from radical but easy to drive. Looking around underneath, you'll see a rec
title: 1970 Ford Mustang

description: For sale in our Houston Showroom is a very iconic 1972 Ford Mustang Mach 1. This 1972 Mach 1 is a super clean H code Pony! The "H Code" represents a 351 Cubic Inch 2 Valve V8 which pumped out a very respectable 240 horsepower. In 1972, this powerful pony pumped out enough power to launch the Mustang 's sales in the right direction even though it was the largest production Mustang to date. The V8 power plant is paired to an SelectShift Cruise-o-Matic automatic transmission that does an amazing job of planting power to pavement. This iconic pony car is sporting a coat of Mustang red paint with a two-tone hood with functional air scoops to help this pony breathe. Upon its introduction to the Mustang line-up, the Mach 1 nameplate always ensured a sportier and more muscular version of the already impressive Mustang. This car has a recent electronic system upgrade with a new distributor, coil, relay and wires. The interior is wrapped in Brown Saddle vinyl and retains much of its originality just as it did when this Mustang rolled off the assembly line and has a modern AC system so youÃ¢??ll cruise in cool comfort. This Mach 1 includes; A/C, AM/FM CD, P/S, P/B, Vinyl Interior,Seat Belts and a Tilt Wheel. This Mach 1 has a perfect stance as it rests comfortably on its original style chrome rally wheels wrapped in newer radial tires and also do a perfect job of allowing this Mustang to maintain its originality. If you are in the market for a Mach 1, your search ends here. For more information on this 1972 Mach 1 including HD photos and video, please visit www.GatewayClassicCars.com. To contact us on this Mach 1 emal us at Houston@GatewayClassicCars.com or call the Houston showroom at 832-243-6220.
title: 1972 Ford Mustang

description: Gateway Classic Cars of Houston is proud to offer this beautiful 1971 Ford Mustang Convertible. This Mustang is powered by the stout 351 CID Cleveland V8 engine mated to a smooth shifting 3-speed automatic transmission. 16 years ago the car received a fresh paint job and it still looks great to this day. It has a red exterior and a durable and a pretty black vinyl interior. Inside you will be kept cool with air conditioning for those warm summer days with the top down. The top is power for added convenience. Your music of choice will be available through the AM/FM radio and cassette player that you will find in the dash. Maybe it will be Brown Sugar by The Rolling Stones which aired for the first time when this car was built! This would be the perfect car for the drive in. IÃ¢??m sure that in 1971 you saw a few convertible Mustangs on the way to see Clockwork Orange for the first time in the theaters. Driving in this classic is made easy with power steering and safety is added with seat belts. The 1971 Mustang, introduced in September 1970, was green-lighted by Ford's new president, Semon "Bunkie" Knudsen, formerly of General Motors. Again, the revised model grew, gaining 3 inches in width in order to accommodate Ford's big block 429 cu in (7.0 L) V8 without need for an extensive suspension redesign. This is a beautiful car and at this price it wonÃ¢??t last. DonÃ¢??t miss your chance to take this one home. Call the Houston showroom at (832) 243-6220 for more information on this vehicle. If you are viewing this on a 3rd party website then you will be able to find more pictures and an HD video by visiting www.gatewayclassiccars.com. Our showroom is open to the public and you can visit us 9-5 Mon-Sat at 71 Esplanade Blvd Suite 100, Houston, TX 77060.
